programme.desc: Martha brings the outdoors inside the home and shares her love of houseplants; she shows how to take care of the most popular houseplants and how to propagate them to create new plants.

programme.desc: Martha explores how to care for succulents including watering, fertilizing, and repotting.

programme.title: Martha Gardens

programme.sub-title: Inside Martha's Vegetable Greenhouse; Seed Starting

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha serves up delicious homemade pizzas alongside friends and pizza chefs Christian Petroni and Dean Medico; featuring classic pizzas, signature sauces, and more.
programme.sub-title: Pizza Perfection: Sicilian and Neapolitan-Style Pizzas

programme.title: Martha Cooks

programme.sub-title: Japanese Cuisine: Sushi, Sashimi and More

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha starts off brunch with a citrus cocktail Mary's knees; Chef Ignacio Mattos joins and makes an omelette with caviar and creme fraiche; Martha makes an endive salad; Martha makes waffles.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha journeys through her local area in search of the ultimate fresh-baked croissants and sourdough bread; learning about homemade bread and pastries.
programme.sub-title: How to Make Croissants and Sourdough Bread

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha is in the test kitchen with English chef, restaurateur, and author Jamie Oliver, and they're cooking up a mouth-watering menu of dishes that are easy to make.
programme.sub-title: One Pot Wonders With Jamie Oliver

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha and her niece Sophie visit their favorite tea shop, Arogya, in Westport, Conn., to discover the do's and don'ts of making tea; they return to Martha's kitchen to create dishes with tea.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha visits Mast Market in Mt. Kisco, N.Y., and learns the art behind making their renowned chocolate; from roasting cacao, to stone grinding, to forming delicious bars and chips.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha shares techniques for making the perfect burgers; Pat LaFrieda joins Martha to grind his beef mix; Thomas Joseph joins to make a hake fish burger and Martha shares her turkey burger.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Frisee aux lardons; Caesar salad; stacked butter lettuce with citrus and yuzu vinaigrette.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Sorrel soup; pasta with grilled sardines and bitter greens; Swiss chard frittata; kale Caesar salad; escarole.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Stovetop clambake in a stockpot; risotto with shrimp and herbs in a pressure cooker; poached cod with tomatoes in a skillet; arroz con pollo in a Dutch oven.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Baked stuffed clams; searing a porterhouse steak; creamed spinach; baked potatoes with various garnishes.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Buckwheat crepes filled with a mushroom mixture; vegetarian mushroom ragu served on rigatoni; French mushroom soup; mushroom risotto made with farro.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Five classic sandwiches -- roasted chicken club, New Orleans po'boy with oysters, muffuletta, applewood-smoked bacon and fried egg sandwich, and a Reuben.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Traditional turkey; roasting turkey in parchment paper; braising turkey legs; roasted rolled turkey breast with herbs.

programme.title: Martha Bakes

programme.title: Martha Bakes

programme.title: Emeril's Table

programme.title: Emeril's Table

programme.title: Emeril's Table

programme.sub-title: Chef's Tricks of the Trade: Insider Kitchen Tools

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Popular and satisfying soups: an easy and affordable cuban black bean soup; a flavorful and filling tortilla soup; a classic french onion soup topped with crispy croutons and bubbling gruyere cheese.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Emeril shows brides-to-be the correct cookware to use including a wok which is ideal to make a quick and easy stir fried squid with chili sauce. A cast iron skillet is used to prepare sirloin steak fajitas.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Creamy turnip and parsnip soup.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Emeril makes his ultimate triple chocolate cake which is a moist chocolate cake layered with chocolate mousse and topped with a dark chocolate ganache.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Portuguese style grilled sardines.

programme.title: Emeril Cooks
programme.desc: Emeril prepares a meal any kid (or adult) would love, for budding young chef CJ Calhoun, a mentee of the New Orleans non-profit, Son of a Saint.

programme.title: Emeril Cooks

programme.title: Emeril Cooks
programme.desc: TV personality Big Freedia ("Big Freedia: Queen of Bounce") joins, and Emeril prepares the rapper's favorite meal.
programme.sub-title: Southern Feast Fit for a "Bounce" Queen

programme.title: Emeril Cooks

programme.desc: After dying and entering Hell, a teenager, Amagane, makes unexpected friends with the demons in her new class in this anime tale.

programme.title: Kimagure Orange Road: The Movie
programme.desc: Fifteen-year-old Kyousuke moves to a new city and becomes enamored with Madoka. Kyousuke and his family all have powers that Kyousuke tries to keep a secret, but some of the other family members have no such qualms against using their powers in public.

programme.title: In This Corner Of The World [English-Language Version]
programme.desc: A spirited 18-year-old woman is married off to a man she barely knows and must soon adjust to the struggles of living in Hiroshima during World War II.

programme.title: Giovanni's Island [English-Language Version]
programme.desc: A dramatic yet heart-warming story of cross-cultural friendship among children in the aftermath of WWII, presented by Tokyo-based award-winning animation studio Production I.G. Based on true events.

programme.title: The House Of The Lost On The Cape [English-Language Version]
programme.desc: A strange old woman allows a teenage runaway and a young orphan to stay in an abandoned house overlooking the sea. However, when a menacing entity threatens their new home, they must band together and face their fears to save it.

programme.title: Bleach: Fade to Black
programme.desc: Ichigo must fight a lonely battle to save Rukia before the two are forced to part ways forever!

programme.title: Demon City Shinjuku
programme.desc: A young warrior battles against a city overtaken by demons, one devil at a time. To save Tokyo from evil, he must defeat a sinister psychic from the underworld.

programme.title: Street Fighter II: The Animated Movie
programme.desc: Based on the legendary video game series. This anime classic follows Ryu, a talented fighter who may be the greatest in all of the world, and Bison, the evil mastermind searching for Ryu's talents.

programme.title: City Hunter: Goodbye My Sweetheart
programme.desc: When a mysterious soldier called The Professor seeks vengeance on the government, he demands to be paid an exorbitant ransom --or else Tokyo gets blown to smithereens. Only City Hunter (Ryo Saeba) stands a chance of stopping him from wiping out the city.

programme.title: Black Knight
programme.desc: When a wisecracking black hustler from South Central L.A. finds himself transported back to medieval England, he leads the overthrow of an evil king and wins the heart of a proto feminist woman.

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: Two young people are entangled in the ongoing battle between good and evil.

programme.title: Runaway Jury
programme.desc: In this suspenseful thriller, a high-priced and ruthless jury "consultant" will stop at nothing to secure a verdict on an explosive trial.

programme.title: Heartbreakers
programme.desc: Max and Page are a brilliant mother and daughter con team who have their gift down to a fine art.

programme.title: We Were Soldiers
programme.desc: The story of the first major battle of the American phase of the Vietnam War, and the soldiers on both sides that fought it. Feat: Mel Gibson.

programme.title: Open Water: Open Water
programme.desc: When a couple is stranded while scuba diving, they soon realize they are in the middle of shark-infested waters in this intense, critically acclaimed thriller.

programme.title: Big Momma's House
programme.desc: In order to protect a woman from a robber, a male FBI agent disguises himself as an elderly woman.

programme.title: My All American

programme.title: To the Ends of Time
programme.desc: In a mythical kingdom, a young boy must fight time itself for the love of his princess and the future of his land.

programme.title: The Secret Garden
programme.desc: Experience the magical world of 'The Secret Garden' as never before in this beautiful production of the classic tale. When her parents are lost in a tragic accident, Mary must seek comfort in the strange and forgotten corridors of Misselthwaite Factory.

programme.title: Just My Luck
programme.desc: Sexy Manhattanite Ashley is known as the luckiest woman around, but after a chance romantic encounter with down-and-out Jake, she realizes that she's swapped her fortune for his.

programme.title: The Dark Crystal
programme.desc: On another planet in the distant past, a Gelfling embarks on a quest to find the missing shard of a magical crystal, and to restore order to his world.

programme.title: Windstorm
programme.desc: Rebel teen Mika encounters a beautiful, wild stallion named Windstorm at her grandmother's riding school and learns she can communicate with horses.

programme.title: Good Witch
programme.desc: A raven-haired enchantress, Cassie Nightingale, mysteriously moves into the local haunted mansion, 'Grey House', and seems to change her neighbors lives using a hint of magic causing many to think she’s a witch.

programme.title: Pudsey The Dog: The Movie
programme.desc: Pudsey The Dog: The Movie is ‘Babe’ meets ‘Marley and Me’ - a cheeky and downright hilarious animal adventure for the whole family! Oh and by the way… there are songs too!

programme.title: Heaven Must Wait
programme.desc: An American inherits an old village church in England, where treasure is buried. Greedy Mr. Slee scents his opportunity to snatch the treasure. Diggity, a little cherub trying to earn his wings, helps uncover the treasure for the benefit of the village.

programme.title: Slow Moe
programme.desc: When struggling baseball player Marvin finds a pair of glasses that transform him into a star player, he thinks he can't win without the glasses. But when they disappear, Marvin's teammates help him realize winning doesn't mean anything.

programme.title: The Adventurer: Curse of the Midas Box
programme.desc: Transporting you to a rambunctious realm of enchanting fantasy. When Mariah's little brother is kidnapped, he follows a trail of clues to discover a hidden realm of monsters, ancient secrets and a long-lost artefact. Feat: Michael Sheen & Sam Neill.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Weekend Warriors
programme.desc: Tuna.com continues its winning streak, catching two fish in one day while the rest of the fleet struggles to even find a spot to fish in between the weekend recreational boaters.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Size Matters
programme.desc: Meet Kevin and the Christina, a boat that gets its own real-life fish story when it snags an 1,100-pound \\"monstah\\" right out of the gate.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Greed, Ego & Jealousy
programme.desc: After watching the Christina catch the biggest tuna of the season, the uber-competitive Captain Dave of the Tuna.com is obsessed with beating the record, and catching a fish bigger than 1,075 lbs!

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Mann gegen Sturm
programme.desc: Marciano, captain of Hard Merchandise, risks the elements to hook a giant bluefin and finds himself with boat trouble in the midst of the storm.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Mutiny at Sea
programme.desc: A mixture of bad luck and mutiny brews in this tumultuous episode of Wicked Tuna. Tensions erupt on New England's top tuna boat, Tuna.Com, when Captain Dave and Paul get into a heated confrontation that causes Paul to quit!

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Grudge Match
programme.desc: With just two weeks left until the end of tuna fishing season, Bounty Hunter gains a new deckhand.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Captain Ralph in Not
programme.desc: A hard season with little money to show has taken its toll on the crew of the Odysea, leading Captain Ralph to lash out at his first mate Pirate.

programme.desc: As the final week of tuna fishing begins, the Hard Merchandise, the Bounty Hunter, the Tuna.Com and the Odysea steam out together, each captain vowing to catch the biggest tuna before the season ends.

programme.desc: A crime boss tries to make off with loot that belongs to another thief.

programme.title: Night Raiders
programme.desc: A mother joins an underground band of vigilantes to try and rescue her daughter from a state-run institution.

programme.title: Brick Mansions
programme.desc: An undercover Detroit cop (Paul Walker) navigates a dangerous neighborhood that's surrounded by a containment wall with the help of an ex-con in order to bring down a crime lord and his plot to devastate the entire city.

programme.title: Precious Cargo
programme.desc: A crime boss tries to make off with loot that belongs to another thief.

programme.title: Night Raiders
programme.desc: A mother joins an underground band of vigilantes to try and rescue her daughter from a state-run institution.

programme.title: Beeba Boys
programme.desc: A ruthless mobster leads his soldiers into a turf war for control of the Vancouver drug and arms trafficking rackets.

A young woman comes to in a roadside diner with no idea where she is or how she got there. Split between two timelines, she gets taken on a violent journey as she seeks out the person responsible for her lover's death.

programme.title: Beeba Boys
programme.desc: A ruthless mobster leads his soldiers into a turf war for control of the Vancouver drug and arms trafficking rackets.

A young woman comes to in a roadside diner with no idea where she is or how she got there. Split between two timelines, she gets taken on a violent journey as she seeks out the person responsible for her lover's death.

programme.title: Entanglement
programme.desc: While searching for the meaning of his existence, Ben uncovers a secret that leads him to a woman named Hanna. When Ben falls for Hanna his life becomes increasingly and strangely complicated.

programme.title: Room for Rent
programme.desc: When a broke thirty-two year old ex-lottery winner convinces his parents to rent their spare room to save from downsizing, a creepy stranger with a hidden agenda moves in.

programme.title: Blue State
programme.desc: In this delightful romantic comedy, when his candidate loses the U.S. presidential election, a fervent liberal (Breckin Meyer) makes good on his promise to move to Canada and meets a sexy and mysterious young woman (Anna Paquin) along the way.

programme.title: Entanglement
programme.desc: While searching for the meaning of his existence, Ben uncovers a secret that leads him to a woman named Hanna. When Ben falls for Hanna his life becomes increasingly and strangely complicated.

programme.title: Room for Rent
programme.desc: When a broke thirty-two year old ex-lottery winner convinces his parents to rent their spare room to save from downsizing, a creepy stranger with a hidden agenda moves in.

programme.title: Cake
programme.desc: A carefree travel writer is forced to take a job as editor of a bridal magazine after a family emergency. Can the commitment-phobic party girl adapt to her new life filled with wedding dresses and romance?

programme.title: White Coats aka Intern Academy
programme.desc: Dan Aykroyd ("The Blues Brothers") stars in this comedy about the madcap misadventures of a group of medical school interns.

programme.title: Cake
programme.desc: A carefree travel writer is forced to take a job as editor of a bridal magazine after a family emergency. Can the commitment-phobic party girl adapt to her new life filled with wedding dresses and romance?

programme.title: White Coats aka Intern Academy
programme.desc: Dan Aykroyd ("The Blues Brothers") stars in this comedy about the madcap misadventures of a group of medical school interns.

programme.title: Flower Shop Mystery: Dearly Depotted
programme.desc: Abby Knight, ex-lawyer, crime buff and owner of Bloomers Flower Shop, is having a week to be reckoned with. A reluctant bridesmaid at wedding, Abby ends up not just doing the flowers, but having to solve a murder.

programme.title: Love Under the Rainbow
programme.desc: Lucy wasn't sure if she would find true love, until Jack moves to town with his daughter Sophie. Together they teach her it's never too late to start chasing rainbows!

programme.title: My Birthday Romance
programme.desc: Callie Fitzgerald is tired of her family fixing her up and questioning her single status. She is determined to find a pretend boyfriend for her 35th birthday party just so her family will leave her alone.

programme.title: Winter Castle
programme.desc: Born and raised in sunny California, Jenny is thrilled when her sister Meg decides to have a destination wedding at an ice hotel. Jenny is immediately entranced by the magical décor of the hotel.

programme.title: Blueprint to the Heart
programme.desc: Interior designer and house flipper trying to save her home improvement show needs to apply her successful 'fixer upper' home buying strategy to her blue collar contractor.

programme.title: Baby Bootcamp
programme.desc: When super cute fitness instructor Julia Penman turns thirty with no husband prospect in sight, she vows to start a family of her own – with or without a man.

programme.title: Flower Shop Mystery: Mum's the Word
programme.desc: Abby Knight, a former lawyer turned proud flower shop owner, is starting over after the death of her husband with the support from her father, a new business and her daughter off to college.

programme.title: Unexpected Grace
programme.desc: When lonely young Grace finds a note from a schoolgirl looking for a friend, she excitedly writes back, setting off a chain of events that ultimately changes the lives of three people.

programme.title: Game of Love
programme.desc: Audrey, a creative board game designer and Matthew, a research-driven marketing consultant, are tasked with creating a new game to help players find romance.

programme.title: Cooking with Love
programme.desc: Hardworking and optimistic television producer, Kelly, doesn't have time for love. Along with her mentor Amanda, Kelly dives into another season of the Little Gourmet, a kids cooking show.

programme.title: Magic Stocking
programme.desc: A young widow finds a tattered old Christmas stocking at a Holiday craft sale, but is skeptical of its magic when it seems to create small trinkets on its own.

programme.title: Our Italian Christmas Memories
programme.desc: The Colucci siblings, in an effort to jog the memory of their grandfather who is struggling with dementia, set out to recreate their late grandmother’s legendary pasta sauce.

programme.title: Christmas on My Mind
programme.desc: When Lucy wakes up with a wedding dress in hand, she believes that she is late to her wedding with her ex-boyfriend Zac. However, she has no recollection of the past 2 years.

programme.title: Finding Father Christmas
programme.desc: Christmas for Miranda is a painful reminder of the family she never had. Her mother died when she was young, never revealing the identity of her father. But, three days before Christmas, she unexpectedly receives a clue.

programme.title: Christmas Scavenger Hunt
programme.desc: When Belinda heads back to her hometown for the holidays, things get complicated when she is forced to team up with her ex, Dustin, at the town's annual Christmas scavenger hunt.

programme.title: A Dickens of a Holiday!
programme.desc: To make the 100th anniversary of her hometown’s Victorian festival a success, Cassie invites action movie star and former high school classmate Jake to play Scrooge in 'A Christmas Carol'.

programme.title: A Homecoming for the Holidays
programme.desc: Country singer Charlotte is home for the holidays and brother Ryan's fellow ex-soldier Matt is in town. Writing her new album, Charlotte works with Matt to build a house for a friend in town.

programme.title: Three Wise Men and a Baby
programme.desc: Three brothers get the surprise of their lives when they are forced to work together and care for a baby over the holidays.

programme.title: Inventing the Christmas Prince
programme.desc: Shelby is about to quit her job as a rocket engineer when her daughter becomes convinced that her Scrooge-like boss, Evan, is the Christmas Prince; a story Shelby invented years ago.

programme.title: My Grown Up Christmas List
programme.desc: Taylor and Luke have a special bond that grows between them after several Christmases spent together and apart.

programme.title: A Glenbrooke Christmas
programme.desc: Longing to be accepted for herself and not just her wealth, an heiress heads to the small town of Glenbrooke, where she discovers the joys of a simple Christmas, community, and maybe even love.

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
programme.desc: An offbeat look at the Spanish Inquisition; an unconventional version of "Wuthering Heights." Also: a jury plays charades while delivering its verdict; a man attempts to find one nontaxable pleasure.

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
programme.desc: Sketches include: Flying Lessons, Hijacked Plane, Psychiatrist Milkman, Complaints, Déjà vu.

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
programme.desc: A super-sleuth bishop investigates a suspicious insurance business; an elderly couple construct a house that has no walls.

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
programme.desc: Contestants vie for incriminating photos in "The Blackmail Game"; a boxer spars with schoolgirls.
programme.sub-title: Live From The Grill-O-Mat Snack Bar, Paignton

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
programme.desc: Sketches include: The time on BBC 1, School Prize Giving, Films by Mr. Dibley, Timmy Williams Interview, Election Night Special

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus

programme.title: Giants of Fortune - The Whale Sharks of Oslob
programme.desc: In the little Filipino village of Oslob on the Cebu Island, people suffer from typhoons and overfishing. Until the world’s biggest fish and the Internet change everything.Fisherman Zosimo’s dearest wish is for his children to graduate from high school one day. Yet the chance that this wish will come true is tiny, since at times Zosimo doesn’t even manage to feed the family. Typhoons and overfishing make the lives of Oslob fishermen difficult.

programme.title: Symphony of the Seas - Underwater Wonders of Australia's Ocean
programme.desc: Our journeys take us all around the world from Patagonia to the USA, from Greenland to South Africa and from Cambodia to Australia and leads us to the most fascinating places where landscapes animals and humans are the main focus of our documentaries. Whether on land or at sea – the last paradises of the world are our destination.

programme.title: The Last Paradises: Patagonia - Coast of the Killer Whale
programme.desc: On the wild coast of Patagonia, the nature calendar describes the most diverse visiting times of fascinating animals, from the southern right whale and other large whales, via the sea lions and elephant seals up to the orcas and millions of penguins. The encounters with whales and their babies are spectacular. Hardly anywhere else on earth can one experience both the brutal and the delightful sides of nature so vividly and so close. The trip to the hot spots for animal watchers and researchers leads us inter alia to the Caleta Valdez. This is where, during the mating season, the southern elephant seals bring their babies into the world, mate and enjoy a little sunbathing on the beach.

programme.title: Blue Whisper
programme.desc: "Blue Whisper" immerges into the ocean's fascinating underwater world and gets to the bottom of a widely unexplored field of underwater science: The communication amongst fish. The 3D-Documentary accompanies a team of specialists to overwhelmingly beautiful coral reefs, ancient shipwrecks in the Mediterranean Sea and sunken submarines that are clouded in secrecy, to explore the versatile forms of underwater communication. What language do fish use? Do they make sounds? Do they have a body language? And what role do colors play? With the aid of complex underwater video- and audio- equipment those and further questions are answered during a suspenseful journey around the world.

programme.title: Mysterious Oceanic Oases - Hotspots of Life
programme.desc: Countless marine animals frolic on the steep slopes of underwater volcanoes. In many cases, several are rare species not found elsewhere. This is in part due to the fact that plankton clings to the wall and provides the fish with food in abundance. This documentary shows several of these oases and also examines the impact dive tourism has and whether preventive measures can help to maintain them. Nature and underwater filmmaker Rolf Möltgen undertakes dives into the mysterious underwater mountain landscapes with marine scientists from all corners of the globe. This journey takes us to Mexico, to snappers, white-tip reef sharks, Galapagos sharks and giant mantas. We visit the Maldives, Colombia and Costa Rica, where the team documents rare species such as deep sea burbots, small tooth sand tiger and dogfish sharks, in depths of more than 3 metres. The eerie underwater mountain world proves: everyone plays a part in the network of life. Thanks to consistent protective regulations, it has been possible to retain the underwater diversity - especially in the unique oases of the high seas

programme.title: Billion Dollar Fish
programme.desc: They are virtually unchanged from their ancestors, who swam in ancient rivers when the dinosaurs still ruled the planet. Their unfertilised eggs became black gold, served in only the most expensive restaurants as caviar. This ancient giant is the Beluga Sturgeon, considered by some to be the largest freshwater fish in the world. Sturgeons are now at the very edge of extinction because of the exclusive market for their eggs, but only the eggs can allow the species to live. Paradoxically, the desire for caviar may now be the only chance they have for their future existence.

programme.title: Penguin City - South Georgia
programme.desc: In the middle of the Antarctic Ocean, an entire mountain range arises from the water: South Georgia, the nursery of the Antarctic. Hundreds of thousands of penguins, elephant seals, fur seals and their young overcrowd the beaches. The rough weather and the extremely difficult access to the island cause filmmaking to be an endeavor requiring much of the film crew around Roland Gockel and Rosie Koch and the state of the art cameras. A lot of patience and sensitivity over a period spanning some five years now offers unknown and poignant insights into the life of the King Penguins on South Georgia Island

programme.title: Strandwolf
programme.desc: She moves through the seal colony on Namibia’s wild Skeleton Coast with purpose and focus, gingerly stepping around the adults who snap at her heels. She’s searching for smaller prey. Following her is a young German field scientist, Ingrid Wiesel, who has now spent 17 years with Tosca’s clan; tracking, observing, and learning everything she can about one of the world’s least understood and most unusual predators.

programme.title: Red Panda - World's Cutest Animal
programme.desc: The Red Panda is undoubtedly one of the most beautiful animals on earth and this is the first ever intimate portrait ever made.

programme.title: Animal Homes
programme.desc: Everyone needs a place to live, but some aren't happy with the great outdoors, they look for some home comforts - they use extraordinary specialist building skills to construct the perfect home. Homes have many uses. They can prove a bolthole to escape predators, a safe nursery in which to raise young, a food store and a shelter from bad weather.

programme.title: One Year in Norway's Lofoten
programme.sub-title: One Year in Norway's Lofoten: Episode 1
programme.desc: Winter means more than just the beginning of the year for the people of Lofoten: For more than a thousand years, Lofoten has been a hub for cod fishing, with seasons lasting from February to April as huge shoals migrate from the Barents Sea to these waters. During these hectic months, more than 65,000 tons of fish are brought to shore, securing the income for the whole of Lofoten for years to come. Around a quarter of the fish caught ends up on lines to dry upon racks. From a young age, the children from the fishing villages get to earn some pocket money by cutting cod tongues and selling the produce as a delicacy appreciated by the locals.

programme.title: One Year in Norway's Lofoten
programme.sub-title: One Year in Norway's Lofoten: Episode 2
programme.desc: Almost unnoticeably, spring turns into summer. The days become longer and longer, with a never-setting sun. People who have spent their winter and spring working hard can finally enjoy their own nature, even though the temperature is only slightly warmer. Lofoten is sparsely populated, just 24,000 people live here. Unstad is one of its smallest communities with only 15 inhabitants, but despite that, it has become a hotspot for arctic surf and is host to the northern-most surf center in the world. Surfers from all over the globe come to surf in the arctic water.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In Provence
programme.desc: Its native fragrant flowers and aromatic herbs have made the Provence a brand known worldwide. The wealth of flora found in this region, between the French Alps and the Mediterranean, is unequalled among the French provinces. Around Sault, near Mont Ventoux, the valleys and high plains are carpeted with bright violet: In the hot climate of the South of France, lavender blooms and exudes its fragrance. Monastic healers have been using its aromatic medicinal oil since the Middle Ages. And today an entire industry is based on the trade with this fragrant flower. Yet the livelihood of Provençal lavender farmers is imperiled. In France’s major lavender-growing region, the “Plateau de Valensole”, our viewers encounter Gérard Blanc, who has been hit particularly hard. The lavender farmer lost sixty percent of his harvest to one tiny insect: the leafhopper. This insect has already destroyed half of the lavender acreage, bumping France from its market position as the world’s top producer of lavender oil. The film visits a resolute farmer who, not about to give up, is testing methods to fend off the voracious insect.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In India
programme.desc: In India, herbs play an everyday role hardly equalled anywhere in the world. From the tropical green south to the mountains of the northern Himalayas, herbs lend fragrance to joss sticks and soaps, and flavor to the cuisine. And, above all, herbs heal. Six thousand varieties of plants are used in India, and most are harvested in the wild – where they are becoming depleted. The ever rising need for herbal medicine for the subcontinent’s 1.3 billion inhabitants comes on top of the demand of its growing middle class for herbal-based cosmetics. As a result, certain herbs have become scarce, while others have already vanished entirely. Most of the herbs in India are harvested in the wild. The progress of first cultivation attempts is slow. In India, the rural population, especially, needs affordable, well-tolerated medicine – medicine based on herbs. In Kerala, the film shows a family operation that hand-produces botanical medicine for the local market. High up in the Himalayas, we observe a village healer at work. The science of Ayurvedic medicine is five thousand years old. Today, interest in the ancient healing art is surging, not only in India. In Delhi’s Old Town, the film visits a wholesaler who supplies the booming global herb market, and we take a look inside the laboratories of the largest manufacturer of Ayurvedic medicines in the world. In Kerala, we meet a doctor employed at a small Ayurveda clinic, and in Nordern India, we join a student of Tibetan medicine on a hike up into the mountains, where she prepares for an exam in herbology.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In Latin America
programme.desc: Healing effects, fragrance, and intense flavor – the benefits of herbs were discovered by the indigenous peoples of South America long before Spanish conquistadores subdued the continent. Even today, in the remote regions of South America, life without herbs is unthinkable. For many inhabitants, they provide the sole medicine. For more than two thousand years, this wisdom of the healing powers of nature has been passed down from generation to generation. In Bolivia, the film accompanies ethnobiologist Rainer Bussmann on one of his expeditions documenting which herbs the locals use against which illnesses. The German scientist has spent the last 15 years in the region, focussed on preserving this invaluable knowledge.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In the Alps
programme.desc: Secluded for many centuries in inaccessible valleys, the inhabitants of the Alps had no alternative but to rely on the healing powers of nature. A knowledge of herbs was deeply rooted in these mountain-dwellers’ everyday lives – until the twentieth century, when this wisdom became eclipsed by modern academic medicine. Today, Alpine herbs are witnessing a revival, as public interest in regional natural treasures grows. The potential of Alpine herbs is far from exhausted. In the Berchtesgaden Alps, the film shows Hubsi Ilsanker at work as a root-digger, a back-breaking job that has scarcely changed in four hundred years. Authorized by a special historic permit to supply the oldest gentian distillery in Germany, Hubsi digs for protected gentian roots in Berchtesgaden National Park. For yellow gentian is one of the most bitter medicinal herbs in the world, well suited for schnapps and as a general tonic.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret world of Herbs - In the Balkans
programme.desc: In the pristine nature and mild climate of southeastern Europe grows a unique diversity of wild plants. Far removed from major industry and polluted soils, the Balkan countries have become the largest exporter of herbs in Europe. In Bulgaria alone, more than 300,000 people work with domestic plants. The business is becoming increasingly lucrative. The film takes us to the Croatian coast. On the Adriatic island of Cres, the audience meets Mladen Dragoslavić. In May, when the sage begins to blossom, this beekeeper has one month to produce his income for an entire year – always with the goal of creating the best sage honey in the Balkans. Given a choice, the bees would never choose sage, for entering and exiting the narrow blossom is strenuous. Within three weeks, maximum, Mladen must remove his bees from the island. Otherwise they will die of exhaustion. In Skopje, the capital of Macedonia, the film visits Iva Yosifova. Hollyhock provides the raw material for her objects of art. The herb is medically beneficial, due to its mucilage, which is added to many cough tea mixtures. Iva, though, makes paper from hollyhock. Thanks to the herb’s long fibres, the paper can be spread onto objects and modeled. The technique produces delicate sculptures, as fragile as nature.

programme.title: Aurora - Fire in the Sky
programme.desc: In the earth’s polar regions, a ghostly flicker and colourful glow often brighten the night sky. Whoever sees an aurora event will never forget this impressive experience. Finland’s Saami people, Alaska’s Inuit, Canada’s Native Americans and New Zealand’s Maori all have legends about the origins and meaning of this magic natural spectacle. These stories tell of spirits dancing in the sky, of a bright and better world where hunting game is abundant, of battling gods and celestial messages.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: What ideas are people on the 15th meridian east developing to shape the future and leave tomorrow's generations a home worth living in? This consequence leads us to four future designers. From the barren Namib Desert to the glacier worlds of Spitsbergen, Sicily and the Croatian Mediterranean.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: The journey leads from the Norwegian Vesterålen to Chad, the Aeolian Islands and the Polish Giant Mountains. As different as the landscapes and cultures may be, all people are united in their love for their children and their desire to give something to tomorrow's generation.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: This episode focuses on people from five countries who share a common passion: The production of their own food and food. What culinary treasures are hidden in the different regions, from Spitsbergen to Sweden, Austria, Poland and Chad?

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: Almost 11000 kilometres lie between the northernmost and southernmost point of the 15th meridian east. Here you will find extreme landscapes such as the shimmering heat of Africa or the eternal cold of northern Scandinavia. Five people from Spitsbergen, Namibia, Slovenia, Germany and Poland dedicate their lives to environmental protection.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: As contrasting as the landscapes of the 15th meridian east, so different are its animal inhabitants. What are the living conditions like in the heat of the Namibian Damaraland, in Lusatia or on the coast of Norway? Which challenges do elephants, whales or kingfishers have to master together with their companions from north to south?

programme.title: The marvellous World of French Rivers
programme.desc: The Gironde is the largest and most powerful tidal current in Europe. When the Gironde flows into the Atlantic, it is 15 kilometers wide and in the rhythm of the tides, it brings the waters from the Pyrenees and the Massif Central into the ocean. This often pushes its waters far out into the Gironde at high tide.This creates a world of its own that has shaped everything uniquely and intensely for tens of thousands of years. The water surface of the river is so large that the evaporation has created its own microclimate, which is stable and, together with the brackish waters, has influenced flora and fauna on the right and left of the bank for a long time.

programme.title: The marvellous World of French Rivers
programme.desc: The Dordogne consists of a visible and an invisible system of flowing water. Caves and basins under the earth's surface store the excess water and return it to the river when it is dry. A perfect management of a precious resource, not invented by humans, but by the complex nature itself. The result is an ever life-giving river.

programme.title: One Year in Norway's Lofoten
programme.sub-title: One Year in Norway's Lofoten: Episode 1
programme.desc: Winter means more than just the beginning of the year for the people of Lofoten: For more than a thousand years, Lofoten has been a hub for cod fishing, with seasons lasting from February to April as huge shoals migrate from the Barents Sea to these waters. During these hectic months, more than 65,000 tons of fish are brought to shore, securing the income for the whole of Lofoten for years to come. Around a quarter of the fish caught ends up on lines to dry upon racks. From a young age, the children from the fishing villages get to earn some pocket money by cutting cod tongues and selling the produce as a delicacy appreciated by the locals.

programme.title: Germany's Underworld
programme.sub-title: From the Harz Mountain to the North Sea
programme.desc: In this episode meet the ancient Atlantic sturgeon, the ground beetle, the sea eagle, and a family of beavers.

programme.title: Ibex: Acrobats On The Rocks
programme.desc: The film follows Buck, an Alpine Ibex from Italy's Gran Paradiso, highlighting his life and majestic beauty.

programme.title: Dehesa
programme.desc: The Iberian Peninsula, rich in ecosystem and dance, attracts visitors like acorn-fed pigs.

programme.title: Jerte, Wildlife In The Cherry Valley
programme.desc: Southwest Spain's snow-covered valley, with goats, cherries, and Hatay river, is a must-see.

programme.title: I'm The Best Iberian Red Deer
programme.desc: Iberian stags battle eagles and vultures in harsh weather, preparing nests for breeding.

programme.title: Raccoons - The New Europeans
